intro: Houstonia longipes, commonly known as the pink trailing jewelpop, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, trailing growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to white, often with a yellowish throat. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often root at the nodes. Houstonia longipes thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded woodlands and along stream banks.
